NeedDef.label: caffeine
NeedDef.description: Because of a caffeine addiction, this person needs to regularly consume the drug to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

HediffDef.label: caffeine tolerance
HediffDef.description: A built-up tolerance to caffeine. The more severe this tolerance is, the more caffeine it takes to get the same effect.

HediffDef.label: caffeine addiction
HediffDef.description: A chemical addiction to caffeine. Long-term presence of caffeine has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of caffeine, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.

li.label: caffeine withdrawal
li.description: I'm tired and unfocused. Why can't I have a cup of coffee?
